attributes.action: Allow international travel to places not on red list when vaccinated from Covid
attributes.additional_details: The travel industry has been hit hard and people need to have some respite from these never ending restrictions.  International travel should have been stopped earlier in 2019/20. Now the virus is better controlled it is like shutting the stable door after the horse has bolted. The NHS has done a magnificent job and are now able to treat patients effectively.  Let not the healthy majority of people be prevented from enjoying their freedom at the expense of those unfortunate few who suffer.
attributes.background: Do not renege on promise to open up international travel after May 15th.  Consider allowing international travel again to countries not on the red list providing travellers have been vaccinated against covid 19.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

The Government has announced its intention for international travel to resume on 17 May. We're not sure whether you want international travel limited only to vaccinated people, or something else. 

Read more:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/global-travel-taskforce-sets-out-framework-to-safely-reopen-international-travel
